subject: College Athletics
College World Series
Softball
lead_paragraph: The freshman Niki Williams hit her first home run in three months, and Danielle Lawrie, the national player of the year, threw a six-hitter as third-seeded Washington beat Georgia, 3-1, in the opening game of the Women’s College World Series. Amanda Chidester homered and Teddi Ewing had three hits and two runs batted in as Michigan beat Alabama, 6-1. The Wolverines took an early lead by capitalizing on wild pitching by Kelsi Dunne, who last weekend became the first pitcher to throw back-to-back no-hitters in the N.C.A.A. tournament.
